intro: Prangos pauciradiata, commonly known as the desert thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is characterized by its spiny, gray-green foliage and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to survive in dry, sandy soils. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, where it can withstand high temperatures and low moisture. Prangos pauciradiata is adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native range.
